metadata.title: CVE-2024-57904 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:iio: adc: at91: call input_free_device() on allocated iio_devCurrent implementation of at91_ts_register() calls input_free_deivce()on st->ts_input, however, the err label can be reached before theallocated iio_dev is stored to st->ts_input. Thus callinput_free_device() on input instead of st->ts_input.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of ESM support').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
